doc.after: St. Croix lies at 17Â°45â²N 64Â°45â²Wï»¿ / ï»¿17.750Â°N 64.750Â°Wï»¿ / 17.750; -64.750: the easternmost point in the United States of America is St. Croix's Point Udall. The island has an area of 214.66Â kmÂ² (82.88 sq mi). The terrain is rugged, though not extremely so. The highest point on the island, Mount Eagle, is 1,165 feet (355 m) high. Most of the east end is quite hilly and steep, as is the north side from Christiansted west. From the north side hills, a fairly even plain slopes down to the south coast: this was cultivated as the prime sugar land on the island.
